Common Market / Royal College of Art

Experimental Comics — Dog Walk

A collaborative experiment into narrative comics, storytelling and structured remixes.

Over six panels, a dog goes for a walk, makes a positive observation, and experiences a new and interesting smell.

Artists are invited to contribute a 6-panel comic which will be printed in the collection and sold at Common Market on the 20th April.

Rules for submissions

  1. Starring characters are the dog and the kiwi bird. You're welcome to introduce one new character.
  2. A new smell is experienced by the dog in every comic.
  3. The first event in these comics is a positive observation.
  4. Every comic ends with a cliffhanger, which may or may not be resolved in the next comic.
  5. 2 colours: black and yellow.
  6. Six panels per comic. Download the .PSD template.
  7. Draw outside the panels if you need to, but leave enough room for the title of the comic and your name.
  8. The characters should be identifiable, but other than that, draw them however you like.

*Note on colours: The comic will be Riso printed, so comics need to be submitted with colours separated onto a different layer – eg a PDF with black on one page, and yellow on the next page.

Template grid

Dates

10th April – deadline for comics submissions

20th April – Common Market opens
